text: RT @RepBillJohnson: The coronavirus crisis has starkly illustrated the lack of high-speed broadband in sections of E/SE Ohio. ‚ÄúThe Serving‚Ä¶

.@NTCAconnect: ‚ÄúWe applaud the efforts of Rep. Wittman to support the deployment of broadband infrastructure. #SRAAct2020 represents a significant advancement in the discussion about how best to solve our country‚Äôs remaining broadband challenges.‚Äù

The grant program created by #SRAAct2020 encourages provider coordination to determine available service in a proposed area and prevents overbuilding by limiting federal broadband support to one provider in a rural area. This is must-pass legislation to close the #digitaldivide. https://t.co/kM2gazXhhK

Specifically #SRAAct2020:

- Creates a grant program through the FCC to expand broadband service to unserved areas of the country
- Modeled to utilize public/private partnerships
- Features a challenge process to eliminate duplicate efforts
- Technology neutral
Today I introduced the Serving Rural America Act to help bring access to the approximately 19 million Americans who still lack high speed internet. #SRAAct2020 https://t.co/N5TlzMrDcX

(1/3) Currently our @USNavy‚Äôs two hospital ships ‚Äì #MercyAndComfort ‚Äì are in Los Angeles and New York City helping with the #COVID„Éº19 response. 2 years ago, these ships were at risk of being to be decommissioned. I fought to ensure these ships stayed active, and was successful.

(5/5) I want to thank @FCC, particularly @AjitPaiFCC and @BrendanCarrFCC, for accelerating and pushing telehealth to the forefront. I applaud our incredible healthcare providers and know that these increased telehealth services will relieve some of the strain they are facing.

(4/5) To participate, eligible health care providers would submit a streamlined application to @FCC, and FCC would award these funds to applicants on a rolling basis until the $200M is exhausted or until this outbreak is over. As soon as the app is available I will distribute it.

(3/5) These telehealth services would help #COVID19 patients and provide care for non-COVID-19 patients with non-related conditions who might risk contracting the coronavirus when visiting a hospital or other healthcare facilities, freeing up hospital space and resources.
(2/5) The #COVID19 Telehealth Program will help eligible health care providers purchase telecomms, broadband connectivity, and devices necessary for providing telehealth services.
(1/5) Today, with $200M from the recently passed CARES Act, @FCC approved a measure that will increase and improve telehealth capabilities to help fight the #coronavirus pandemic.
